intro: Otatea ximenae, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Otatea ximenae is relatively low-maintenance and can be grown in containers or in gardens with well-draining soil.
